body:
### Describe the issue

I haven't space enough on my SSD drive in my laptop to download the whole blockchain and I don't want use Bitcoin on Windows. So I decide to run the Bitcoin Core on a Linux distro (Lubuntu) as a Virtual Machine but I can't setup Bitcoin Core to use an external hard drive mounted as vsboxsf in it as my -datadir option.

### Can you reliably reproduce the issue?
#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
1. Run a Lubuntu Guest VM with VirtualBox and Windows 10 as Host
2. Install bitcoin-qt and run it with -datadir option on a shared folder of an external hard drive mounted using vboxsf.

### Expected behaviour

Should open Bitcoin Core nicely and start synchronizing the blockchain using the external hard drive shared folder.

### Actual behaviour

Pop up an error "Error opening block database" and close Bitcoin Core unexpectedly.

### Screenshots.
![virtualbox_lubuntu_03_07_2017_15_45_47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28768905/27805013-7209bfe6-6008-11e7-8f25-4a306aa9b772.png)
![virtualbox_lubuntu_03_07_2017_15_46_46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28768905/27805014-722325e4-6008-11e7-9836-3dab502df0bb.png)


### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
Bitcoin Core v0.14.2.0-gfc61c83

### Machine specs:

- OS: Windows 10 Host - Lubuntu 17.04 VM Guest running on VirtualBox 5.1.22
- CPU: Intel Core i7 CPU 2.20 GHz
- RAM: 8 GB
- Disk size: 223 GB SSD on my machine, 30 GB Virtual Disk for VM and 1 TB on External Hard Drive
- Disk Type (HD/SDD): SSD
